title: Strava Privacy Policy
intro: Your privacy is very important to us. This visualization of our privacy policy explains the data we collect, how we use and share it, how to manage your privacy controls and your rights in connection with Strava’s websites and the related mobile applications and services (collectively, the “Services”). To view the full privacy policy, click here. To learn about how we protect data, click here. To learn about managing your settings, click here.

successor_links.text: Strava may share your data with third parties who provide services to Strava.

When you choose to use third party apps, plugins, or websites that integrate with the Services, or when you use Strava features that are offered in conjunction with third parties such as a sponsored challenge, they may receive your data and content.
As a social network, Strava shares your data with other Strava members and the public in accordance with your privacy controls.

We may share your data with affiliates under common control with us, who are required to comply with the terms of this Privacy Policy with regard to your data. If Strava becomes involved in a business combination, securities offering, bankruptcy, reorganization, dissolution or other similar transaction, we may share or transfer your data in connection with such transaction.
We may preserve and share your data with third parties for legal requirements.
We may share your data with third parties when we forward Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) notifications, which will be forwarded as submitted to us without any deletions.

Strava may aggregate the data you and others make available in connection with the Services and post it publicly or share it with third parties. To do this, we remove certain account data, such as your name, and combine the resulting data with similar data from other Strava athletes.
Strava collects basic account data to help secure and provide you with access to our Services.
Strava collects activity data when you choose to upload content, join a challenge, add your equipment usage, view others’ activities, or otherwise use the Services.

You can choose to add your contacts’ data by connecting your contacts from your mobile device or social networking accounts to Strava. In accordance with your instructions, Strava may then access and store your contacts’ data in order to identify connections and help you connect with them.
Strava collects data from devices and apps you connect to Strava.
Strava may collect health data. Before you can upload health data to Strava, you must give your explicit consent to the processing of that health data by Strava.
Strava gathers data from content you share on the Services, including when you participate in partner events or create segments or routes.
When you make a payment on Strava, you may provide payment data to Strava.
When you make a payment on Strava, you may provide payment data to third parties.
Strava collects and processes location data when you sign up for and use the Services.

When you sign up and log in to the Services using accounts you create with third-party products and services, such as Facebook or Google (collectively, “Third-Party Accounts”), Strava may collect data provided to Strava under the Third-Party Account provider's privacy policies. You can generally control the data that we receive from these sources using the privacy controls in your Third-Party Account.
You can choose to provide us with your contact data so we can better respond to your support requests and comments.

Strava obtains additional third party data about our members from marketers, partners, researchers, and others. We may combine data that we collect from you with data obtained from other members, third parties and data derived from any other subscription, product, or service we provide. We may also collect data about you from other members such as when they give you kudos or comment on your activities.
Strava collects device data that provides us with technical information when you access or use the Services.
Strava uses log files to collect additional data.

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.text: All of your data that Strava collects. This is made up of many different kinds of data, which are shown in other circles in the diagram that are connected to this circle.

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.text: Data necessary to provide services to Strava such as supporting and improving the Services, promoting the Services, processing payments, or fulfilling orders. Service providers will only have access to the data necessary to perform these limited functions on our behalf and are required to protect and secure your data.

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.data_handler: Third party apps, plugins, or websites
nodes.text: Data and content, including your photos and your activity data (including private activities).

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.text: Your data and content.

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.data_handler: Affiliates under common control with Strava

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.data_handler: Third parties, including law enforcement, public or governmental agencies, or private litigants, within or outside your country of residence,
nodes.text: Your data, if we determine disclosure is allowed by the law or reasonably necessary to comply with the law, or if disclosure is reasonably necessary or appropriate to prevent any person from death or serious bodily injury, to address issues of national security or other issues of public importance, to prevent or detect violations of our Terms of Service or fraud or abuse of Strava or its members, or to protect our operations or our property or other legal rights.

nodes.label: All Data Strava Collects about You
nodes.text: Your data, when we forward Digital Millennium Copyright Act (DMCA) notifications.

successor_links.text: Strava may use, sell, license, and share aggregated data with third parties for research, business or other purposes such as to improve walking, running or riding in cities via Strava Metro or to help our partners understand more about athletes, including the people who use their products and services.

nodes.label: Aggregated Statistics about Users
nodes.text: Aggregated information about users, with names removed. Examples include data about equipment, usage, demographics, routes and performance.

nodes.opts_text: Please visit your privacy controls if you object to Strava sharing this data.
nodes.label: Aggregated Statistics about Users
nodes.text: Aggregated information about users, with names removed. Examples include data about equipment, usage, demographics, routes and performance.

successor_links.text: Subject to your privacy controls, your username will be shared on Strava so that you may be able to participate in the Services, for example to show your place on a leaderboard.

nodes.label: Basic Account Data
nodes.text: Name, email address, date of birth, gender, username and password.

successor_links.text: Subject to your privacy controls, your profile and activities will be shared on Strava so that you may be able to participate in the Services, for example to show your place on a leaderboard.
Strava may make certain profile data available to non-members on the web.

nodes.label: Profile, Activity and Use Data
nodes.text: Pictures, activities (including date, time and geo-location data as well as your speed and pace) and posts, and other data about your use of the Services.

nodes.label: Public Profile
nodes.text: Name and some profile data.

nodes.opts_text: Learn more about how we collect data about your contacts, how we use that data, and the controls available to you.
nodes.label: Your Contacts’ Data
nodes.text: Data about your contacts on your mobile device or social networking accounts.

successor_links.text: Subject to your privacy controls, the devices you use will be shared on Strava so that you may be able to participate in the Services, for example to show your place on a leaderboard.

nodes.label: Connected Devices and Apps
nodes.text: Data from devices and apps you connect to Strava. For example, you may connect your Garmin watch or Flywheel account to Strava and data from these devices and apps will be passed along to Strava.

successor_links.text: Certain health data may be inferred from various indicators.

nodes.opts_text: Before you can upload health data to Strava, you must give your explicit consent to the processing of that health data by Strava. You can withdraw your consent to Strava processing your health data at any time.
nodes.label: Health Data
nodes.text: Health data from sources such as heart rate, power, cadence, height and weight and other indicators.

nodes.opts_text: You can withdraw your consent to Strava processing your health data at any time.
nodes.label: Inferred Health Data
nodes.text: Health data inferred from other data.

successor_links.text: Subject to your privacy controls, the kudos and comments you give and receive will be shared on Strava so that you may be able to participate in the Services, for example to show your place on a leaderboard.

nodes.label: Content You Share
nodes.text: Photos, posts, comments, kudos and other content you share on the Services.

nodes.label: Kudos and Comments
nodes.text: Kudos and comments you give and receive.

nodes.label: Payment Data
nodes.text: Payment card and other payment details. We do not store your credit card data.

nodes.label: Payment Data
nodes.data_handler: Payment Card Industry compliant third-party payment services
nodes.text: Payment card and other payment details.

successor_links.text: Strava may share your precise location data on Strava with non-members, in accordance with your privacy controls.

nodes.opts_text: You can tell us about important locations, such as your home or work address, by enabling a Privacy Zone in your settings. We will make private any portion of your activity that starts or ends in your Privacy Zone.
nodes.label: Location Data
nodes.text: Physical location of your device including, data such as speed and direction. Processing of your location data is essential to the Services which we provide and a necessary part of our performance of the agreement we have with you.

nodes.opts_text: You can control this sharing in your privacy controls.
nodes.label: Location Data
nodes.text: Precise location data, such as a route or segment.

nodes.label: Third-Party Account Data
nodes.text: Data that you have agreed to make available such as your name, email address, profile data and preferences with the applicable Third-Party Account.

nodes.label: Data from Others
nodes.text: Data about you from third parties and other members.

nodes.label: Device Data
nodes.text: Data from your browser, computer, or mobile device, including device and network data, cookies, log files and analytics data.

nodes.label: Data from Log Files
nodes.text: IP addresses, browser type, internet service provider (ISP), referring/exit pages, platform type, date/time stamp, and number of clicks.

node_types.description: All data Strava collects about you
All data Strava collects about you

link_types.label: Include as Part of All Data Collected
Other
link_types.description: Change or share in some other way

use_types.description: Do anything that this policy allows Strava to do with all data it collects. For more, see the big circle in the middle.
Detect and prevent violations of the terms of service
Do anything that this privacy policy allows Strava to do
Allow you to participate in sweepstakes, contests, and other promotions
Conduct research and development on services
Conduct research not related to services
Not limited by this privacy policy
